abstract: Updated at 5:18 p.m. Tearing a hole in the veil secrecy surrounding Swiss banking, UBS will pay $780 million to settle federal claims that it had helped wealthy Americans evade taxes, and it agreed to disclose the names of 19,000 clients, The New York Times’s Lynnley Browning reports.
lead_paragraph: Updated at 5:18 p.m. Tearing a hole in the veil secrecy surrounding Swiss banking, UBS will pay $780 million to settle federal claims that it had helped wealthy Americans evade taxes, and it agreed to disclose the names of 19,000 clients, The New York Times’s Lynnley Browning reports.

headline.main: UBS to Pay $780 Million to Settle Tax Case
